workflow.name: Summarize meeting transcripts with GPT-4 & sentiment analysis for Gmail
workflow.description:
## Who it's for
Project managers, AI builders, and teams who want structured, automated meeting summaries with zero manual work.

## What it does
This workflow monitors a Google Drive folder for new meeting notes (PDF/TXT), extracts text, summarizes it via OpenAI GPT-4o, groups tasks by sentiment, builds a styled HTML summary, and sends it via Gmail.

## How to set it up
1. Connect Google Drive, OpenAI, and Gmail credentials.  
2. Point the Drive Trigger to your meeting notes folder.  
3. Paste the system prompt into the AI node.  
4. Set Gmail Email Type to **HTML** and Message to `{{$json.email_html}}`.  
5. Drop a test file and execute once.

## Requirements
- n8n account  
- Google Drive, OpenAI, and Gmail credentials  
- Non-scanned PDFs or plain text files

## Customization ideas
- Add Slack or Notion logging  
- Support additional file types  
- Translate summaries automatically

## Tags
#ai #automation #productivity #gmail #drive #meeting-summary #openai

options.systemMessage:
You are a helpful You are a rigorous meeting assistant. Convert the provided meeting text into a project plan.
Return ONLY strict JSON with these keys and types:
- summary: string (<= 40 words)
- decisions: string[]
- notes: string[]
- meeting_sentiment: one of {"positive","neutral","negative"}
- tasks: array of objects {
   description: string,
   owner: string | "TBD",
   deadline: ISO date string | "TBD",
   sentiment: one of {"positive","neutral","negative"}
}
Constraints:
- No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- If unknown, use empty list or "TBD".
- Infer dates only if clearly stated; otherwise "TBD".
assistant

parameters.content:
## üß© AI Meeting Summary & Email Automation

Automatically turn meeting files (PDF or TXT) uploaded to Google Drive into structured summaries with decisions, notes, and action items ‚Äî then email them beautifully formatted via Gmail.

---

### üß† How It Works
1. Watch a Google Drive folder for new files  
2. Extract text (from PDF or TXT)  
3. Send content to OpenAI GPT-4o-mini  
4. Parse and group tasks by sentiment  
5. Build an HTML summary  
6. Email it automatically

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup
1. Connect Google Drive, OpenAI, and Gmail credentials  
2. Point the Drive Trigger to your ‚ÄúMeetings‚Äù folder  
3. Paste the system prompt into the AI node  
4. Set Gmail message field to `{{$json.email_html}}`  
5. Drop a file in the folder ‚Äî everything runs end-to-end!

---

üí° *Perfect for team syncs, standups, sprint reviews, or client calls.*

## Google Drive Trigger + File Routing

**Watch New Files (Meeting Notes Folder)**  
Starts the workflow whenever a new file appears in your Drive folder.

**Check File Type (PDF or Text)**  
Routes files by MIME type:  
- ‚úÖ `application/pdf` ‚Üí PDF extraction path  
- ‚úÖ `text/plain` ‚Üí TXT extraction path  

---

üí° *Keeps the workflow flexible for multiple file formats.*

## AI Summarization

This step is where the AI does all the heavy lifting.  
It takes the extracted meeting text and uses **OpenAI GPT-4o-mini** to:

- Read through the entire meeting transcript  
- Identify and summarize key decisions and discussion points  
- Extract important notes and insights  
- Detect overall **meeting sentiment** (positive, neutral, or negative)  
- Generate structured **tasks** with owners, deadlines, and sentiment tags  

The output is a **strict JSON object**, which ensures the next nodes can automatically parse, format, and send the results without manual cleanup.

##  Validate & Structure Output

**Normalize AI Output (Code Node)**  
- Parses JSON safely  
- Groups tasks by sentiment (`positive`, `neutral`, `negative`)  
- Builds a `totals` object for quick statistics  
- Prevents null/undefined errors in next step

---

üí° *Ensures every summary email is structured and reliable.*

## Generate HTML Summary

**Generate HTML Report (Code Node)**  
Converts the normalized JSON into a professional email-ready layout.

Includes:
- üìù Summary  
- üí° Key Decisions  
- üóíÔ∏è Notes  
- ‚úÖ / ‚ö™ / ‚ùå grouped tasks  
- Inline CSS for Gmail readability

---

üìÑ Output variable: `email_html`

##  Send AI-Generated Report

**Send AI Meeting Summary Email (Gmail)**  
- **Email Type:** HTML  
- **Message:** `{{$json.email_html}}`  
- **Subject Example:**  
  `AI Summary ‚Äì {{$json.meeting_sentiment}} | ‚úÖ{{$json.totals.positive}} ‚ö™{{$json.totals.neutral}} ‚ùå{{$json.totals.negative}}`

---

üì¨ *Delivers the final meeting digest automatically to your inbox.*

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
